Name: Round basket with lid
Description: This small round basket with a lid, which was part of the G. Hagemans collection, was made by means of the wrapping technique. A small bundle of reed was twisted together, rolled in spirals and held by a process which consists of attaching a part of each turn to the next turn. The piece, of which the date is not known with certainty, is distinguished by its work of crossed wrappings (cross with four branches).
